intro: Paederia scandens f. microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved climbing piper, is a variant of the species Paederia scandens, belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a climbing shrub characterized by its small, ovate leaves that are typically less than 2 cm in length. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, spherical berries. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its foliage and flowering habits make it a notable species in ecological studies and horticultural applications.
